</BODY>
</HTML>

</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-14.1
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>d12235exv14w1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-14.1 CODE OF BUSINESS CONDUCT AND ETHICS
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv14w1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<P align="right"><FONT size="2"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;14.1</B>
</FONT>


<P align="center"><FONT size="2"><B>PATTERSON-UTI ENERGY, INC.</B>
</FONT>


<P align="center"><FONT size="2"><B>CODE OF BUSINESS CONDUCT AND ETHICS<BR>
FOR SENIOR FINANCIAL EXECUTIVES</B>
</FONT>


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">A.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Policy
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">It is the policy of Patterson-UTI Energy, Inc. and its
subsidiaries (the &#147;Company&#148;) to conduct its business in accordance
with the highest standards of honesty and integrity, the provisions
of this Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Senior Financial
Executives (the &#147;Code&#148;), other Company policies and all applicable
laws and regulations of the United States, and the states, counties,
cities and other jurisdictions in which the Company operates.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">In addition to the requirements and expectations contained in
the Company&#146;s general policies and procedures, the Company believes
that Senior Financial Executives should abide by a further code of
ethics to ensure that the Company maintains the highest integrity
with respect to the preparation and reporting of financial
information related to the Company. Accordingly, this Code shall
apply to the following: the Chief Executive Officer, all Senior Vice Presidents, the
Chief Financial Officer,  the Chief Accounting Officer and the
Controller, and persons performing similar functions (the &#147;Senior
Financial Executives&#148;).
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">B.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Focus
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">This Code is intended as a codification of standards that are
reasonably designed to deter wrongdoing and to promote and reinforce
the following:
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">a.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Honest and ethical conduct, including ethical
handling of actual or apparent conflicts of interest between
personal and professional relationships.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">b.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Full, fair, accurate, timely and understandable
disclosure in reports and documents that the Company files
with or submits to the Securities and Exchange Commission
(&#147;SEC&#148;) or releases to the public.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">c.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Compliance with applicable governmental laws,
rules and regulations.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">d.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The prompt reporting to an appropriate person or
persons identified in this Code of violations of the Code.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">e.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Accountability with respect to adherence to this
Code.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">C.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Disclosure Controls
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Each Senior Financial Executive shall endeavor, through
actions which include, without limitation, the establishment,
maintenance and periodic evaluation of appropriate disclosure
controls and procedures and internal controls, to ensure
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>


<P align="center"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">that, with respect to each current, quarterly or annual report
filed by the Company with the SEC (each a &#147;Report&#148;):
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">a.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The Report does not contain any untrue statements
of material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary in
order to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not
misleading.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">b.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The financial statements, and other financial
information contained in each Report fairly present in all
material respects the financial condition and results of
operations of the Company as of, and for, the periods
presented in the Report.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">c.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The Report discloses financial information
relating to the Company in a full, fair, accurate, timely and
understandable manner.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Each Senior Financial Executive shall endeavor to design
disclosure controls and procedures and internal controls to ensure
that material information relating to the Company and its
consolidated subsidiaries is made known to such Senior Financial
Executives by others within the Company.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">D.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Accuracy and Completeness
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Senior Financial Executives, as the primary executives
responsible for the complete and accurate financial reporting of the
Company, to the best of their ability, shall not permit the public
reporting of any financial information of the Company which they
believe is false or misleading in any material respect.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Should any Senior Financial Executive have reason to believe
that the Company has reported or may be intending to report any
false or misleading financial information, he/she shall promptly
advise the Chief Executive Officer of the Company. If having done
so, such Senior Financial Executive believes that appropriate action
will not be taken to present such reporting, then the Senior
Financial Executive shall report the matter to the Chairman of the
Audit Committee of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;).
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">E.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Prior Employment
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Each Senior Financial Executive shall fully disclose to the
Chairman of the Audit Committee of the Board any prior employment of
such executive with any accounting firm which the Company has
engaged or proposes to engage, to perform auditing services.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Each Senior Financial Executive shall also fully disclose the
scope of any work performed for the Company while employed by such
accounting firm, and the time period during which such work was
performed.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>


<P align="center"><FONT size="2">- 2 -
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">F.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Questionable Transactions
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">No Senior Financial Executive, shall, directly or indirectly,
through any business entity in which he/she or any of such
executive&#146;s family members have an interest or otherwise, engage in
any transaction with the Company which is required to be reported
in, or requires the exercise of any judgment as to whether it is
required to be reported in, the financial records or statements of
the Company.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The following are exceptions:
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">a.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Regular compensation, including bonuses, and
employee benefits received in such executive&#146;s capacity as an
executive and employee of the Company.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">b.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Transactions in goods and services routinely
engaged in by the Company with its unaffiliated clients or
customers on terms, subject to customary employee discounts
and benefits, generally offered to its unaffiliated clients
and customers.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">c.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Transactions with publicly held entities in which
the executive has less than 1% equity interest and with
respect to which transactions such executive has no
decision-making role on behalf of such entity.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">d.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Transactions, or transactions normally arising
out of business arrangements, fully disclosed to and approved
in advance by the Audit Committee of the Board.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">G.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Prompt Disclosure
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Each Senior Financial Executive shall promptly disclose to
the Chairman of the Audit Committee of the Board his/her knowledge
of the following:
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">a.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">All significant deficiencies in the design or
operation of the Company&#146;s internal controls which could
adversely affect the Company&#146;s ability to accurately record,
process, summarize, and report financial data.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">b.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Any material weakness in the Company&#146;s internal
controls.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">c.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves
the Company&#146;s management or other employees who have a
significant role in the Company&#146;s internal controls or the
proper recording, processing, summarizing or reporting of the
Company&#146;s financial information.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The Senior Financial Executives shall ensure that each
Report, to the extent required by any law, rule or regulation,
fully, accurately and timely discloses whether or not there were
significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that
could significantly affect internal controls in connection with such
Report, including any corrective actions with regard to significant
deficiencies and material weakness.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>


<P align="center"><FONT size="2">- 3 -
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">3.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Each Senior Financial Executive shall promptly report to the
Chairman of the Audit Committee of the Board any violations of this
Code.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">H.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Reporting Violations
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">In the event any Senior Financial Executive shall believe
that the Company has engaged or is about to engage in any activity
which violates any foreign, federal, state, or local law, rule or
regulations, such Senior Financial Executive shall promptly advise
the Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Financial Officer, or the
General Counsel in person or by telephone, letter, or electronic
mail as follows:
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">a.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">By Letter:<BR>
Patterson-UTI Energy, Inc.<BR>
4510 Lamesa Highway<BR>
Synder, TX 79549
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="6%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">b.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">By Telephone:<BR>
(325)&nbsp;574-6323
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">If this is uncomfortable or inappropriate, or if having done
so, such Senior Financial Executive believes that appropriate action
will not be taken to address the violation or potential violation,
then such Senior Financial Executive shall report the matter to the
Chairman of the Audit Committee of the Board.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">3.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The Company will not permit retaliation of any kind on or on
behalf of the Company, against a Senior Financial Executive, as a
result of a good faith report or an actual or suspected violation of
this Code or any standard of ethical and lawful conduct.
Retaliation is itself a violation of this Code. Any such
retaliation shall be reported using the reporting procedures
outlined above.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">I.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Enforcement
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">If a Senior Financial Executive is found to be in violation
of this Code, the Company shall take appropriate action up to and
including discharge and, if warranted, legal proceedings.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">To the extent possible, investigations of allegations of
violations of this Code will be maintained in confidence. The
Company will inform only those individuals who have a need to know
of the report in order to conduct a full and fair investigation of
the allegations that have been made.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">J.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">Amendment, Modification, Waiver and Intent
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">1.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">This Code may be amended, modified or waived by the Board of
Directors and waivers may also be granted by the Governance
Committee of the Board subject
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>


<P align="center"><FONT size="2">- 4 -
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">to the disclosure and other provisions of the Securities Exchange
Act of 1934, and the rules thereunder and the applicable rules of
the NASDAQ Stock Market, Inc.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">2.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">This Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Senior Financial
Executives is intended as a directive for the efficient and
professional performance of all Senior Financial Executives.
Nothing herein contained shall be construed to be a contract between
the Company and the Senior Financial Executives. Additionally, this
Code is not to be construed as containing binding terms and
conditions of employment. This employment relationship with the
Company is &#147;at will&#148; and the Company retains the absolute right to
terminate any Senior Financial Executive, at any time, with or
without cause.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">3.</FONT></TD>
 <TD width="1%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
 <TD><FONT size="2">The Company shall immediately disclose, by means of the
filing of a Current Report on Form 8-K or by such other means as the
SEC may require, any amendments to or any waiver of this Code.
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>



<P align="center"><FONT size="2">- 5 -
</FONT>


</BODY>
</HTML>

</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>13
<FILENAME>d12235exv31w1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-31.1 CERTIFICATION OF CEO - RULE 13A-14(A)
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv31w1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<P align="right"><FONT size="2"><B>EXHIBIT 31.1</B>
</FONT>

<P align="center"><FONT size="2"><B>CERTIFICATIONS</B>
</FONT>

<P align="left"><FONT size="2">I, Cloyce A. Talbott, certify that,
</FONT>

<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Patterson-UTI
Energy, Inc;
</FONT>
<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue
statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make
the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements
were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial
information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects
the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant
as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I are responsible for
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in
Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:
</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such
disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its
consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those
entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being
prepared;
</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls
and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the
effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the
period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most
recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of
an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting; and
</FONT>
<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(5)&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based
on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to
the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of
directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design
or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are
reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record,
process, summarize and report financial information;
and
</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or
other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
<DIV align="left">

</FONT>

<P align="center"><FONT size="2"><B>CERTIFICATIONS</B>
</FONT>

<P align="left"><FONT size="2">I, Jonathan D. Nelson, certify that:
</FONT>

<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Patterson-UTI
Energy, Inc;
</FONT>
<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue
statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make
the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements
were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial
information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects
the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant
as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
<P align="left"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I are responsible for
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in
Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:
</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such
disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its
consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those
entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being

and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the
effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the
period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most

materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial

on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to
the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of

</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design

reasonably likely to adversely affect

</FONT>
<P align="left" style="margin-left:2%; margin-right:0%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or

<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<P align="right"><FONT size="2"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;32.1</B>
</FONT>

<P align="center"><FONT size="2">CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO<BR>
18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<BR>

AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR>
SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>

<P align="center"><FONT size="2">NOT FILED PURSUANT TO THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934
</FONT>

<P align="left"><FONT size="2">In connection with the Annual Report of Patterson-UTI Energy, Inc. (the
&#147;Company&#148;) on Form 10-K for the period ending December&nbsp;31, 2003, as filed with
the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;),
Cloyce A. Talbott, Chief Executive Officer, and Jonathan D. Nelson, Chief
Financial Officer, of the Company, each certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section
1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002,
that:
</FONT>

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
       <TD width="4%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
       <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><FONT size="2">(1)
</FONT></TD>
       <TD width="3%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
       <TD><FONT size="2">The Report fully complies with the requirements of section
13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<TR valign="top">
       <TD width="4%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</FONT></TD>
       <TD width="3%"><FONT size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
       <TD><FONT size="2">The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in
all material respects, the financial condition and results of
operations of the Company.
</FONT></TD>
